25/*
26 * Fault Management Architecture (FMA) Resource and Protocol Support
27 *
28 * The routines contained herein provide services to support kernel subsystems
29 * in publishing fault management telemetry (see PSARC 2002/412 and 2003/089).
30 *
31 * Name-Value Pair Lists
32 *
33 * The embodiment of an FMA protocol element (event, fmri or authority) is a
34 * name-value pair list (nvlist_t). FMA-specific nvlist construtor and
35 * destructor functions, fm_nvlist_create() and fm_nvlist_destroy(), are used
36 * to create an nvpair list using custom allocators. Callers may choose to
37 * allocate either from the kernel memory allocator, or from a preallocated
38 * buffer, useful in constrained contexts like high-level interrupt routines.
39 *
40 * Protocol Event and FMRI Construction
41 *
42 * Convenience routines are provided to construct nvlist events according to
43 * the FMA Event Protocol and Naming Schema specification for ereports and
44 * FMRIs for the dev, cpu, hc, mem, legacy hc and de schemes.
45 *
46 * ENA Manipulation
47 *
48 * Routines to generate ENA formats 0, 1 and 2 are available as well as
49 * routines to increment formats 1 and 2. Individual fields within the
50 * ENA are extractable via fm_ena_time_get(), fm_ena_id_get(),
51 * fm_ena_format_get() and fm_ena_gen_get().
52 */
53
54#include <sys/types.h>
55#include <sys/time.h>
56#include <sys/sysevent.h>
57#include <sys/nvpair.h>
58#include <sys/cmn_err.h>
59#include <sys/cpuvar.h>
60#include <sys/sysmacros.h>
61#include <sys/systm.h>
62#include <sys/compress.h>
63#include <sys/cpuvar.h>
64#include <sys/kobj.h>
65#include <sys/kstat.h>
66#include <sys/processor.h>
67#ifdef __NetBSD__
68#include <sys/cpu.h>
69#else
70#include <sys/pcpu.h>
71#endif
72#include <sys/sunddi.h>
73#include <sys/systeminfo.h>
74#include <sys/sysevent/eventdefs.h>
75#include <sys/fm/util.h>
76#include <sys/fm/protocol.h>
77
78/*
79 * URL and SUNW-MSG-ID value to display for fm_panic(), defined below. These
80 * values must be kept in sync with the FMA source code in usr/src/cmd/fm.
81 */
82static const char *fm_url = "http://www.sun.com/msg";
83static const char *fm_msgid = "SUNOS-8000-0G";
84static char *volatile fm_panicstr = NULL;
85
86#ifdef illumos
87errorq_t *ereport_errorq;
88#endif
89void *ereport_dumpbuf;
90size_t ereport_dumplen;
91
92static uint_t ereport_chanlen = ERPT_EVCH_MAX;
93static evchan_t *ereport_chan = NULL;
94static ulong_t ereport_qlen = 0;
95static size_t ereport_size = 0;
96static int ereport_cols = 80;
97
98extern void fastreboot_disable_highpil(void);
99
100/*
101 * Common fault management kstats to record ereport generation
102 * failures
103 */
104
105struct erpt_kstat {
106 kstat_named_t erpt_dropped; /* num erpts dropped on post */
107 kstat_named_t erpt_set_failed; /* num erpt set failures */
108 kstat_named_t fmri_set_failed; /* num fmri set failures */
109 kstat_named_t payload_set_failed; /* num payload set failures */
110};
111
112static struct erpt_kstat erpt_kstat_data = {
113 { "erpt-dropped", KSTAT_DATA_UINT64 },
114 { "erpt-set-failed", KSTAT_DATA_UINT64 },
115 { "fmri-set-failed", KSTAT_DATA_UINT64 },
116 { "payload-set-failed", KSTAT_DATA_UINT64 }
117};
118
119#ifdef illumos
120/*ARGSUSED*/
121static void
122fm_drain(void *private, void *data, errorq_elem_t *eep)
123{
124 nvlist_t *nvl = errorq_elem_nvl(ereport_errorq, eep);
125
126 if (!panicstr)
127 (void) fm_ereport_post(nvl, EVCH_TRYHARD);
128 else
129 fm_nvprint(nvl);
130}
131#endif
132
133void
134fm_init(void)
135{
136 kstat_t *ksp;
137
138#ifdef illumos
139 (void) sysevent_evc_bind(FM_ERROR_CHAN,
140 &ereport_chan, EVCH_CREAT | EVCH_HOLD_PEND);
141
142 (void) sysevent_evc_control(ereport_chan,
143 EVCH_SET_CHAN_LEN, &ereport_chanlen);
144#endif
145
146 if (ereport_qlen == 0)
147 ereport_qlen = ERPT_MAX_ERRS * MAX(max_ncpus, 4);
148
149 if (ereport_size == 0)
150 ereport_size = ERPT_DATA_SZ;
151
152#ifdef illumos
153 ereport_errorq = errorq_nvcreate("fm_ereport_queue",
154 (errorq_func_t)fm_drain, NULL, ereport_qlen, ereport_size,
155 FM_ERR_PIL, ERRORQ_VITAL);
156 if (ereport_errorq == NULL)
157 panic("failed to create required ereport error queue");
158#endif
159
160 ereport_dumpbuf = kmem_alloc(ereport_size, KM_SLEEP);
161 ereport_dumplen = ereport_size;
162
163 /* Initialize ereport allocation and generation kstats */
164 ksp = kstat_create("unix", 0, "fm", "misc", KSTAT_TYPE_NAMED,
165 sizeof (struct erpt_kstat) / sizeof (kstat_named_t),
166 KSTAT_FLAG_VIRTUAL);
167
168 if (ksp != NULL) {
169 ksp->ks_data = &erpt_kstat_data;
170 kstat_install(ksp);
171 } else {
172 cmn_err(CE_NOTE, "failed to create fm/misc kstat\n");
173
174 }
175}
176
177#ifdef illumos
178/*
179 * Formatting utility function for fm_nvprintr. We attempt to wrap chunks of
180 * output so they aren't split across console lines, and return the end column.
181 */
182/*PRINTFLIKE4*/
183static int
184fm_printf(int depth, int c, int cols, const char *format, ...)
185{
186 va_list ap;
187 int width;
188 char c1;
189
190 va_start(ap, format);
191 width = vsnprintf(&c1, sizeof (c1), format, ap);
192 va_end(ap);
193
194 if (c + width >= cols) {
195 console_printf("\n\r");
196 c = 0;
197 if (format[0] != ' ' && depth > 0) {
198 console_printf(" ");
199 c++;
200 }
201 }
202
203 va_start(ap, format);
204 console_vprintf(format, ap);
205 va_end(ap);
206
207 return ((c + width) % cols);
208}
209
210/*
211 * Recursively print a nvlist in the specified column width and return the
212 * column we end up in. This function is called recursively by fm_nvprint(),
213 * below. We generically format the entire nvpair using hexadecimal
214 * integers and strings, and elide any integer arrays. Arrays are basically
215 * used for cache dumps right now, so we suppress them so as not to overwhelm
216 * the amount of console output we produce at panic time. This can be further
217 * enhanced as FMA technology grows based upon the needs of consumers. All
218 * FMA telemetry is logged using the dump device transport, so the console
219 * output serves only as a fallback in case this procedure is unsuccessful.
220 */
221static int
222fm_nvprintr(nvlist_t *nvl, int d, int c, int cols)
223{
224 nvpair_t *nvp;
225
226 for (nvp = nvlist_next_nvpair(nvl, NULL);
227 nvp != NULL; nvp = nvlist_next_nvpair(nvl, nvp)) {
228
229 data_type_t type = nvpair_type(nvp);
230 const char *name = nvpair_name(nvp);
231
232 boolean_t b;
233 uint8_t i8;
234 uint16_t i16;
235 uint32_t i32;
236 uint64_t i64;
237 char *str;
238 nvlist_t *cnv;
239
240 if (strcmp(name, FM_CLASS) == 0)
241 continue; /* already printed by caller */
242
243 c = fm_printf(d, c, cols, " %s=", name);
244
245 switch (type) {
246 case DATA_TYPE_BOOLEAN:
247 c = fm_printf(d + 1, c, cols, " 1");
248 break;
249
250 case DATA_TYPE_BOOLEAN_VALUE:
251 (void) nvpair_value_boolean_value(nvp, &b);
252 c = fm_printf(d + 1, c, cols, b ? "1" : "0");
253 break;
254
255 case DATA_TYPE_BYTE:
256 (void) nvpair_value_byte(nvp, &i8);
257 c = fm_printf(d + 1, c, cols, "%x", i8);
258 break;
259
260 case DATA_TYPE_INT8:
261 (void) nvpair_value_int8(nvp, (void *)&i8);
262 c = fm_printf(d + 1, c, cols, "%x", i8);
263 break;
264
265 case DATA_TYPE_UINT8:
266 (void) nvpair_value_uint8(nvp, &i8);
267 c = fm_printf(d + 1, c, cols, "%x", i8);
268 break;
269
270 case DATA_TYPE_INT16:
271 (void) nvpair_value_int16(nvp, (void *)&i16);
272 c = fm_printf(d + 1, c, cols, "%x", i16);
273 break;
274
275 case DATA_TYPE_UINT16:
276 (void) nvpair_value_uint16(nvp, &i16);
277 c = fm_printf(d + 1, c, cols, "%x", i16);
278 break;
279
280 case DATA_TYPE_INT32:
281 (void) nvpair_value_int32(nvp, (void *)&i32);
282 c = fm_printf(d + 1, c, cols, "%x", i32);
283 break;
284
285 case DATA_TYPE_UINT32:
286 (void) nvpair_value_uint32(nvp, &i32);
287 c = fm_printf(d + 1, c, cols, "%x", i32);
288 break;
289
290 case DATA_TYPE_INT64:
291 (void) nvpair_value_int64(nvp, (void *)&i64);
292 c = fm_printf(d + 1, c, cols, "%llx",
293 (u_longlong_t)i64);
294 break;
295
296 case DATA_TYPE_UINT64:
297 (void) nvpair_value_uint64(nvp, &i64);
298 c = fm_printf(d + 1, c, cols, "%llx",
299 (u_longlong_t)i64);
300 break;
301
302 case DATA_TYPE_HRTIME:
303 (void) nvpair_value_hrtime(nvp, (void *)&i64);
304 c = fm_printf(d + 1, c, cols, "%llx",
305 (u_longlong_t)i64);
306 break;
307
308 case DATA_TYPE_STRING:
309 (void) nvpair_value_string(nvp, &str);
310 c = fm_printf(d + 1, c, cols, "\"%s\"",
311 str ? str : "<NULL>");
312 break;
313
314 case DATA_TYPE_NVLIST:
315 c = fm_printf(d + 1, c, cols, "[");
316 (void) nvpair_value_nvlist(nvp, &cnv);
317 c = fm_nvprintr(cnv, d + 1, c, cols);
318 c = fm_printf(d + 1, c, cols, " ]");
319 break;
320
321 case DATA_TYPE_NVLIST_ARRAY: {
322 nvlist_t **val;
323 uint_t i, nelem;
324
325 c = fm_printf(d + 1, c, cols, "[");
326 (void) nvpair_value_nvlist_array(nvp, &val, &nelem);
327 for (i = 0; i < nelem; i++) {
328 c = fm_nvprintr(val[i], d + 1, c, cols);
329 }
330 c = fm_printf(d + 1, c, cols, " ]");
331 }
332 break;
333
334 case DATA_TYPE_BOOLEAN_ARRAY:
335 case DATA_TYPE_BYTE_ARRAY:
336 case DATA_TYPE_INT8_ARRAY:
337 case DATA_TYPE_UINT8_ARRAY:
338 case DATA_TYPE_INT16_ARRAY:
339 case DATA_TYPE_UINT16_ARRAY:
340 case DATA_TYPE_INT32_ARRAY:
341 case DATA_TYPE_UINT32_ARRAY:
342 case DATA_TYPE_INT64_ARRAY:
343 case DATA_TYPE_UINT64_ARRAY:
344 case DATA_TYPE_STRING_ARRAY:
345 c = fm_printf(d + 1, c, cols, "[...]");
346 break;
347 case DATA_TYPE_UNKNOWN:
348 c = fm_printf(d + 1, c, cols, "<unknown>");
349 break;
350 }
351 }
352
353 return (c);
354}
355
356void
357fm_nvprint(nvlist_t *nvl)
358{
359 char *class;
360 int c = 0;
361
362 console_printf("\r");
363
364 if (nvlist_lookup_string(nvl, FM_CLASS, &class) == 0)
365 c = fm_printf(0, c, ereport_cols, "%s", class);
366
367 if (fm_nvprintr(nvl, 0, c, ereport_cols) != 0)
368 console_printf("\n");
369
370 console_printf("\n");
371}
372
373/*
374 * Wrapper for panic() that first produces an FMA-style message for admins.
375 * Normally such messages are generated by fmd(1M)'s syslog-msgs agent: this
376 * is the one exception to that rule and the only error that gets messaged.
377 * This function is intended for use by subsystems that have detected a fatal
378 * error and enqueued appropriate ereports and wish to then force a panic.
379 */
380/*PRINTFLIKE1*/
381void
382fm_panic(const char *format, ...)
383{
384 va_list ap;
385
386 (void) atomic_cas_ptr((void *)&fm_panicstr, NULL, (void *)format);
387#if defined(__i386) || defined(__amd64)
388 fastreboot_disable_highpil();
389#endif /* __i386 || __amd64 */
390 va_start(ap, format);
391 vpanic(format, ap);
392 va_end(ap);
393}
394
395/*
396 * Simply tell the caller if fm_panicstr is set, ie. an fma event has
397 * caused the panic. If so, something other than the default panic
398 * diagnosis method will diagnose the cause of the panic.
399 */
400int
401is_fm_panic()
402{
403 if (fm_panicstr)
404 return (1);
405 else
406 return (0);
407}
408
409/*
410 * Print any appropriate FMA banner message before the panic message. This
411 * function is called by panicsys() and prints the message for fm_panic().
412 * We print the message here so that it comes after the system is quiesced.
413 * A one-line summary is recorded in the log only (cmn_err(9F) with "!" prefix).
414 * The rest of the message is for the console only and not needed in the log,
415 * so it is printed using console_printf(). We break it up into multiple
416 * chunks so as to avoid overflowing any small legacy prom_printf() buffers.
417 */
418void
419fm_banner(void)
420{
421 timespec_t tod;
422 hrtime_t now;
423
424 if (!fm_panicstr)
425 return; /* panic was not initiated by fm_panic(); do nothing */
426
427 if (panicstr) {
428 tod = panic_hrestime;
429 now = panic_hrtime;
430 } else {
431 gethrestime(&tod);
432 now = gethrtime_waitfree();
433 }
434
435 cmn_err(CE_NOTE, "!SUNW-MSG-ID: %s, "
436 "TYPE: Error, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Major\n", fm_msgid);
437
438 console_printf(
439"\n\rSUNW-MSG-ID: %s, TYPE: Error, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Major\n"
440"EVENT-TIME: 0x%lx.0x%lx (0x%llx)\n",
441 fm_msgid, tod.tv_sec, tod.tv_nsec, (u_longlong_t)now);
442
443 console_printf(
444"PLATFORM: %s, CSN: -, HOSTNAME: %s\n"
445"SOURCE: %s, REV: %s %s\n",
446 platform, utsname.nodename, utsname.sysname,
447 utsname.release, utsname.version);
448
449 console_printf(
450"DESC: Errors have been detected that require a reboot to ensure system\n"
451"integrity. See %s/%s for more information.\n",
452 fm_url, fm_msgid);
453
454 console_printf(
455"AUTO-RESPONSE: Solaris will attempt to save and diagnose the error telemetry\n"
456"IMPACT: The system will sync files, save a crash dump if needed, and reboot\n"
457"REC-ACTION: Save the error summary below in case telemetry cannot be saved\n");
458
459 console_printf("\n");
460}
461
462/*
463 * Utility function to write all of the pending ereports to the dump device.
464 * This function is called at either normal reboot or panic time, and simply
465 * iterates over the in-transit messages in the ereport sysevent channel.
466 */
467void
468fm_ereport_dump(void)
469{
470 evchanq_t *chq;
471 sysevent_t *sep;
472 erpt_dump_t ed;
473
474 timespec_t tod;
475 hrtime_t now;
476 char *buf;
477 size_t len;
478
479 if (panicstr) {
480 tod = panic_hrestime;
481 now = panic_hrtime;
482 } else {
483 if (ereport_errorq != NULL)
484 errorq_drain(ereport_errorq);
485 gethrestime(&tod);
486 now = gethrtime_waitfree();
487 }
488
489 /*
490 * In the panic case, sysevent_evc_walk_init() will return NULL.
491 */
492 if ((chq = sysevent_evc_walk_init(ereport_chan, NULL)) == NULL &&
493 !panicstr)
494 return; /* event channel isn't initialized yet */
495
496 while ((sep = sysevent_evc_walk_step(chq)) != NULL) {
497 if ((buf = sysevent_evc_event_attr(sep, &len)) == NULL)
498 break;
499
500 ed.ed_magic = ERPT_MAGIC;
501 ed.ed_chksum = checksum32(buf, len);
502 ed.ed_size = (uint32_t)len;
503 ed.ed_pad = 0;
504 ed.ed_hrt_nsec = SE_TIME(sep);
505 ed.ed_hrt_base = now;
506 ed.ed_tod_base.sec = tod.tv_sec;
507 ed.ed_tod_base.nsec = tod.tv_nsec;
508
509 dumpvp_write(&ed, sizeof (ed));
510 dumpvp_write(buf, len);
511 }
512
513 sysevent_evc_walk_fini(chq);
514}
515#endif
516
517/*
518 * Post an error report (ereport) to the sysevent error channel. The error
519 * channel must be established with a prior call to sysevent_evc_create()
520 * before publication may occur.
521 */
522void
523fm_ereport_post(nvlist_t *ereport, int evc_flag)
524{
525 size_t nvl_size = 0;
526 evchan_t *error_chan;
527 sysevent_id_t eid;
528
529 (void) nvlist_size(ereport, &nvl_size, NV_ENCODE_NATIVE);
530 if (nvl_size > ERPT_DATA_SZ || nvl_size == 0) {
531 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.erpt_dropped.value.ui64);
532 return;
533 }
534
535#ifdef illumos
536 if (sysevent_evc_bind(FM_ERROR_CHAN, &error_chan,
537 EVCH_CREAT|EVCH_HOLD_PEND) != 0) {
538 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.erpt_dropped.value.ui64);
539 return;
540 }
541
542 if (sysevent_evc_publish(error_chan, EC_FM, ESC_FM_ERROR,
543 SUNW_VENDOR, FM_PUB, ereport, evc_flag) != 0) {
544 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.erpt_dropped.value.ui64);
545 (void) sysevent_evc_unbind(error_chan);
546 return;
547 }
548 (void) sysevent_evc_unbind(error_chan);
549#else
550 (void) ddi_log_sysevent(NULL, SUNW_VENDOR, EC_DEV_STATUS,
551 ESC_DEV_DLE, ereport, &eid, DDI_SLEEP);
552#endif
553}
554
555/*
556 * Wrapppers for FM nvlist allocators
557 */
558/* ARGSUSED */
559static void *
560i_fm_alloc(nv_alloc_t *nva, size_t size)
561{
562 return (kmem_zalloc(size, KM_SLEEP));
563}
564
565/* ARGSUSED */
566static void
567i_fm_free(nv_alloc_t *nva, void *buf, size_t size)
568{
569 kmem_free(buf, size);
570}
571
572const nv_alloc_ops_t fm_mem_alloc_ops = {
573 NULL,
574 NULL,
575 i_fm_alloc,
576 i_fm_free,
577 NULL
578};
579
580/*
581 * Create and initialize a new nv_alloc_t for a fixed buffer, buf. A pointer
582 * to the newly allocated nv_alloc_t structure is returned upon success or NULL
583 * is returned to indicate that the nv_alloc structure could not be created.
584 */
585nv_alloc_t *
586fm_nva_xcreate(char *buf, size_t bufsz)
587{
588 nv_alloc_t *nvhdl = kmem_zalloc(sizeof (nv_alloc_t), KM_SLEEP);
589
590 if (bufsz == 0 || nv_alloc_init(nvhdl, nv_fixed_ops, buf, bufsz) != 0) {
591 kmem_free(nvhdl, sizeof (nv_alloc_t));
592 return (NULL);
593 }
594
595 return (nvhdl);
596}
597
598/*
599 * Destroy a previously allocated nv_alloc structure. The fixed buffer
600 * associated with nva must be freed by the caller.
601 */
602void
603fm_nva_xdestroy(nv_alloc_t *nva)
604{
605 nv_alloc_fini(nva);
606 kmem_free(nva, sizeof (nv_alloc_t));
607}
608
609/*
610 * Create a new nv list. A pointer to a new nv list structure is returned
611 * upon success or NULL is returned to indicate that the structure could
612 * not be created. The newly created nv list is created and managed by the
613 * operations installed in nva. If nva is NULL, the default FMA nva
614 * operations are installed and used.
615 *
616 * When called from the kernel and nva == NULL, this function must be called
617 * from passive kernel context with no locks held that can prevent a
618 * sleeping memory allocation from occurring. Otherwise, this function may
619 * be called from other kernel contexts as long a valid nva created via
620 * fm_nva_create() is supplied.
621 */
622nvlist_t *
623fm_nvlist_create(nv_alloc_t *nva)
624{
625 int hdl_alloced = 0;
626 nvlist_t *nvl;
627 nv_alloc_t *nvhdl;
628
629 if (nva == NULL) {
630 nvhdl = kmem_zalloc(sizeof (nv_alloc_t), KM_SLEEP);
631
632 if (nv_alloc_init(nvhdl, &fm_mem_alloc_ops, NULL, 0) != 0) {
633 kmem_free(nvhdl, sizeof (nv_alloc_t));
634 return (NULL);
635 }
636 hdl_alloced = 1;
637 } else {
638 nvhdl = nva;
639 }
640
641 if (nvlist_xalloc(&nvl, NV_UNIQUE_NAME, nvhdl) != 0) {
642 if (hdl_alloced) {
643 nv_alloc_fini(nvhdl);
644 kmem_free(nvhdl, sizeof (nv_alloc_t));
645 }
646 return (NULL);
647 }
648
649 return (nvl);
650}
651
652/*
653 * Destroy a previously allocated nvlist structure. flag indicates whether
654 * or not the associated nva structure should be freed (FM_NVA_FREE) or
655 * retained (FM_NVA_RETAIN). Retaining the nv alloc structure allows
656 * it to be re-used for future nvlist creation operations.
657 */
658void
659fm_nvlist_destroy(nvlist_t *nvl, int flag)
660{
661 nv_alloc_t *nva = nvlist_lookup_nv_alloc(nvl);
662
663 nvlist_free(nvl);
664
665 if (nva != NULL) {
666 if (flag == FM_NVA_FREE)
667 fm_nva_xdestroy(nva);
668 }
669}
670
671int
672i_fm_payload_set(nvlist_t *payload, const char *name, va_list ap)
673{
674 int nelem, ret = 0;
675 data_type_t type;
676
677 while (ret == 0 && name != NULL) {
678 type = va_arg(ap, data_type_t);
679 switch (type) {
680 case DATA_TYPE_BYTE:
681 ret = nvlist_add_byte(payload, name,
682 va_arg(ap, uint_t));
683 break;
684 case DATA_TYPE_BYTE_ARRAY:
685 nelem = va_arg(ap, int);
686 ret = nvlist_add_byte_array(payload, name,
687 va_arg(ap, uchar_t *), nelem);
688 break;
689 case DATA_TYPE_BOOLEAN_VALUE:
690 ret = nvlist_add_boolean_value(payload, name,
691 va_arg(ap, boolean_t));
692 break;
693 case DATA_TYPE_BOOLEAN_ARRAY:
694 nelem = va_arg(ap, int);
695 ret = nvlist_add_boolean_array(payload, name,
696 va_arg(ap, boolean_t *), nelem);
697 break;
698 case DATA_TYPE_INT8:
699 ret = nvlist_add_int8(payload, name,
700 va_arg(ap, int));
701 break;
702 case DATA_TYPE_INT8_ARRAY:
703 nelem = va_arg(ap, int);
704 ret = nvlist_add_int8_array(payload, name,
705 va_arg(ap, int8_t *), nelem);
706 break;
707 case DATA_TYPE_UINT8:
708 ret = nvlist_add_uint8(payload, name,
709 va_arg(ap, uint_t));
710 break;
711 case DATA_TYPE_UINT8_ARRAY:
712 nelem = va_arg(ap, int);
713 ret = nvlist_add_uint8_array(payload, name,
714 va_arg(ap, uint8_t *), nelem);
715 break;
716 case DATA_TYPE_INT16:
717 ret = nvlist_add_int16(payload, name,
718 va_arg(ap, int));
719 break;
720 case DATA_TYPE_INT16_ARRAY:
721 nelem = va_arg(ap, int);
722 ret = nvlist_add_int16_array(payload, name,
723 va_arg(ap, int16_t *), nelem);
724 break;
725 case DATA_TYPE_UINT16:
726 ret = nvlist_add_uint16(payload, name,
727 va_arg(ap, uint_t));
728 break;
729 case DATA_TYPE_UINT16_ARRAY:
730 nelem = va_arg(ap, int);
731 ret = nvlist_add_uint16_array(payload, name,
732 va_arg(ap, uint16_t *), nelem);
733 break;
734 case DATA_TYPE_INT32:
735 ret = nvlist_add_int32(payload, name,
736 va_arg(ap, int32_t));
737 break;
738 case DATA_TYPE_INT32_ARRAY:
739 nelem = va_arg(ap, int);
740 ret = nvlist_add_int32_array(payload, name,
741 va_arg(ap, int32_t *), nelem);
742 break;
743 case DATA_TYPE_UINT32:
744 ret = nvlist_add_uint32(payload, name,
745 va_arg(ap, uint32_t));
746 break;
747 case DATA_TYPE_UINT32_ARRAY:
748 nelem = va_arg(ap, int);
749 ret = nvlist_add_uint32_array(payload, name,
750 va_arg(ap, uint32_t *), nelem);
751 break;
752 case DATA_TYPE_INT64:
753 ret = nvlist_add_int64(payload, name,
754 va_arg(ap, int64_t));
755 break;
756 case DATA_TYPE_INT64_ARRAY:
757 nelem = va_arg(ap, int);
758 ret = nvlist_add_int64_array(payload, name,
759 va_arg(ap, int64_t *), nelem);
760 break;
761 case DATA_TYPE_UINT64:
762 ret = nvlist_add_uint64(payload, name,
763 va_arg(ap, uint64_t));
764 break;
765 case DATA_TYPE_UINT64_ARRAY:
766 nelem = va_arg(ap, int);
767 ret = nvlist_add_uint64_array(payload, name,
768 va_arg(ap, uint64_t *), nelem);
769 break;
770 case DATA_TYPE_STRING:
771 ret = nvlist_add_string(payload, name,
772 va_arg(ap, char *));
773 break;
774 case DATA_TYPE_STRING_ARRAY:
775 nelem = va_arg(ap, int);
776 ret = nvlist_add_string_array(payload, name,
777 va_arg(ap, char **), nelem);
778 break;
779 case DATA_TYPE_NVLIST:
780 ret = nvlist_add_nvlist(payload, name,
781 va_arg(ap, nvlist_t *));
782 break;
783 case DATA_TYPE_NVLIST_ARRAY:
784 nelem = va_arg(ap, int);
785 ret = nvlist_add_nvlist_array(payload, name,
786 va_arg(ap, nvlist_t **), nelem);
787 break;
788 default:
789 ret = EINVAL;
790 }
791
792 name = va_arg(ap, char *);
793 }
794 return (ret);
795}
796
797void
798fm_payload_set(nvlist_t *payload, ...)
799{
800 int ret;
801 const char *name;
802 va_list ap;
803
804 va_start(ap, payload);
805 name = va_arg(ap, char *);
806 ret = i_fm_payload_set(payload, name, ap);
807 va_end(ap);
808
809 if (ret)
810 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.payload_set_failed.value.ui64);
811}
812
813/*
814 * Set-up and validate the members of an ereport event according to:
815 *
816 * Member name Type Value
817 * ====================================================
818 * class string ereport
819 * version uint8_t 0
820 * ena uint64_t <ena>
821 * detector nvlist_t <detector>
822 * ereport-payload nvlist_t <var args>
823 *
824 * We don't actually add a 'version' member to the payload. Really,
825 * the version quoted to us by our caller is that of the category 1
826 * "ereport" event class (and we require FM_EREPORT_VERS0) but
827 * the payload version of the actual leaf class event under construction
828 * may be something else. Callers should supply a version in the varargs,
829 * or (better) we could take two version arguments - one for the
830 * ereport category 1 classification (expect FM_EREPORT_VERS0) and one
831 * for the leaf class.
832 */
833void
834fm_ereport_set(nvlist_t *ereport, int version, const char *erpt_class,
835 uint64_t ena, const nvlist_t *detector, ...)
836{
837 char ereport_class[FM_MAX_CLASS];
838 const char *name;
839 va_list ap;
840 int ret;
841
842 if (version != FM_EREPORT_VERS0) {
843 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.erpt_set_failed.value.ui64);
844 return;
845 }
846
847 (void) snprintf(ereport_class, FM_MAX_CLASS, "%s.%s",
848 FM_EREPORT_CLASS, erpt_class);
849 if (nvlist_add_string(ereport, FM_CLASS, ereport_class) != 0) {
850 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.erpt_set_failed.value.ui64);
851 return;
852 }
853
854 if (nvlist_add_uint64(ereport, FM_EREPORT_ENA, ena)) {
855 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.erpt_set_failed.value.ui64);
856 }
857
858 if (nvlist_add_nvlist(ereport, FM_EREPORT_DETECTOR,
859 (nvlist_t *)detector) != 0) {
860 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.erpt_set_failed.value.ui64);
861 }
862
863 va_start(ap, detector);
864 name = va_arg(ap, const char *);
865 ret = i_fm_payload_set(ereport, name, ap);
866 va_end(ap);
867
868 if (ret)
869 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.erpt_set_failed.value.ui64);
870}
871
872/*
873 * Set-up and validate the members of an hc fmri according to;
874 *
875 * Member name Type Value
876 * ===================================================
877 * version uint8_t 0
878 * auth nvlist_t <auth>
879 * hc-name string <name>
880 * hc-id string <id>
881 *
882 * Note that auth and hc-id are optional members.
883 */
884
885#define HC_MAXPAIRS 20
886#define HC_MAXNAMELEN 50
887
888static int
889fm_fmri_hc_set_common(nvlist_t *fmri, int version, const nvlist_t *auth)
890{
891 if (version != FM_HC_SCHEME_VERSION) {
892 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
893 return (0);
894 }
895
896 if (nvlist_add_uint8(fmri, FM_VERSION, version) != 0 ||
897 nvlist_add_string(fmri, FM_FMRI_SCHEME, FM_FMRI_SCHEME_HC) != 0) {
898 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
899 return (0);
900 }
901
902 if (auth != NULL && nvlist_add_nvlist(fmri, FM_FMRI_AUTHORITY,
903 (nvlist_t *)auth) != 0) {
904 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
905 return (0);
906 }
907
908 return (1);
909}
910
911void
912fm_fmri_hc_set(nvlist_t *fmri, int version, const nvlist_t *auth,
913 nvlist_t *snvl, int npairs, ...)
914{
915 nv_alloc_t *nva = nvlist_lookup_nv_alloc(fmri);
916 nvlist_t *pairs[HC_MAXPAIRS];
917 va_list ap;
918 int i;
919
920 if (!fm_fmri_hc_set_common(fmri, version, auth))
921 return;
922
923 npairs = MIN(npairs, HC_MAXPAIRS);
924
925 va_start(ap, npairs);
926 for (i = 0; i < npairs; i++) {
927 const char *name = va_arg(ap, const char *);
928 uint32_t id = va_arg(ap, uint32_t);
929 char idstr[11];
930
931 (void) snprintf(idstr, sizeof (idstr), "%u", id);
932
933 pairs[i] = fm_nvlist_create(nva);
934 if (nvlist_add_string(pairs[i], FM_FMRI_HC_NAME, name) != 0 ||
935 nvlist_add_string(pairs[i], FM_FMRI_HC_ID, idstr) != 0) {
936 atomic_inc_64(
937 &erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
938 }
939 }
940 va_end(ap);
941
942 if (nvlist_add_nvlist_array(fmri, FM_FMRI_HC_LIST, pairs, npairs) != 0)
943 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
944
945 for (i = 0; i < npairs; i++)
946 fm_nvlist_destroy(pairs[i], FM_NVA_RETAIN);
947
948 if (snvl != NULL) {
949 if (nvlist_add_nvlist(fmri, FM_FMRI_HC_SPECIFIC, snvl) != 0) {
950 atomic_inc_64(
951 &erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
952 }
953 }
954}
955
956/*
957 * Set-up and validate the members of an dev fmri according to:
958 *
959 * Member name Type Value
960 * ====================================================
961 * version uint8_t 0
962 * auth nvlist_t <auth>
963 * devpath string <devpath>
964 * [devid] string <devid>
965 * [target-port-l0id] string <target-port-lun0-id>
966 *
967 * Note that auth and devid are optional members.
968 */
969void
970fm_fmri_dev_set(nvlist_t *fmri_dev, int version, const nvlist_t *auth,
971 const char *devpath, const char *devid, const char *tpl0)
972{
973 int err = 0;
974
975 if (version != DEV_SCHEME_VERSION0) {
976 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
977 return;
978 }
979
980 err |= nvlist_add_uint8(fmri_dev, FM_VERSION, version);
981 err |= nvlist_add_string(fmri_dev, FM_FMRI_SCHEME, FM_FMRI_SCHEME_DEV);
982
983 if (auth != NULL) {
984 err |= nvlist_add_nvlist(fmri_dev, FM_FMRI_AUTHORITY,
985 (nvlist_t *)auth);
986 }
987
988 err |= nvlist_add_string(fmri_dev, FM_FMRI_DEV_PATH, devpath);
989
990 if (devid != NULL)
991 err |= nvlist_add_string(fmri_dev, FM_FMRI_DEV_ID, devid);
992
993 if (tpl0 != NULL)
994 err |= nvlist_add_string(fmri_dev, FM_FMRI_DEV_TGTPTLUN0, tpl0);
995
996 if (err)
997 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
998
999}
1000
1001/*
1002 * Set-up and validate the members of an cpu fmri according to:
1003 *
1004 * Member name Type Value
1005 * ====================================================
1006 * version uint8_t 0
1007 * auth nvlist_t <auth>
1008 * cpuid uint32_t <cpu_id>
1009 * cpumask uint8_t <cpu_mask>
1010 * serial uint64_t <serial_id>
1011 *
1012 * Note that auth, cpumask, serial are optional members.
1013 *
1014 */
1015void
1016fm_fmri_cpu_set(nvlist_t *fmri_cpu, int version, const nvlist_t *auth,
1017 uint32_t cpu_id, uint8_t *cpu_maskp, const char *serial_idp)
1018{
1019 uint64_t *failedp = &erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64;
1020
1021 if (version < CPU_SCHEME_VERSION1) {
1022 atomic_inc_64(failedp);
1023 return;
1024 }
1025
1026 if (nvlist_add_uint8(fmri_cpu, FM_VERSION, version) != 0) {
1027 atomic_inc_64(failedp);
1028 return;
1029 }
1030
1031 if (nvlist_add_string(fmri_cpu, FM_FMRI_SCHEME,
1032 FM_FMRI_SCHEME_CPU) != 0) {
1033 atomic_inc_64(failedp);
1034 return;
1035 }
1036
1037 if (auth != NULL && nvlist_add_nvlist(fmri_cpu, FM_FMRI_AUTHORITY,
1038 (nvlist_t *)auth) != 0)
1039 atomic_inc_64(failedp);
1040
1041 if (nvlist_add_uint32(fmri_cpu, FM_FMRI_CPU_ID, cpu_id) != 0)
1042 atomic_inc_64(failedp);
1043
1044 if (cpu_maskp != NULL && nvlist_add_uint8(fmri_cpu, FM_FMRI_CPU_MASK,
1045 *cpu_maskp) != 0)
1046 atomic_inc_64(failedp);
1047
1048 if (serial_idp == NULL || nvlist_add_string(fmri_cpu,
1049 FM_FMRI_CPU_SERIAL_ID, (char *)serial_idp) != 0)
1050 atomic_inc_64(failedp);
1051}
1052
1053/*
1054 * Set-up and validate the members of a mem according to:
1055 *
1056 * Member name Type Value
1057 * ====================================================
1058 * version uint8_t 0
1059 * auth nvlist_t <auth> [optional]
1060 * unum string <unum>
1061 * serial string <serial> [optional*]
1062 * offset uint64_t <offset> [optional]
1063 *
1064 * * serial is required if offset is present
1065 */
1066void
1067fm_fmri_mem_set(nvlist_t *fmri, int version, const nvlist_t *auth,
1068 const char *unum, const char *serial, uint64_t offset)
1069{
1070 if (version != MEM_SCHEME_VERSION0) {
1071 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
1072 return;
1073 }
1074
1075 if (!serial && (offset != (uint64_t)-1)) {
1076 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
1077 return;
1078 }
1079
1080 if (nvlist_add_uint8(fmri, FM_VERSION, version) != 0) {
1081 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
1082 return;
1083 }
1084
1085 if (nvlist_add_string(fmri, FM_FMRI_SCHEME, FM_FMRI_SCHEME_MEM) != 0) {
1086 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
1087 return;
1088 }
1089
1090 if (auth != NULL) {
1091 if (nvlist_add_nvlist(fmri, FM_FMRI_AUTHORITY,
1092 (nvlist_t *)auth) != 0) {
1093 atomic_inc_64(
1094 &erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
1095 }
1096 }
1097
1098 if (nvlist_add_string(fmri, FM_FMRI_MEM_UNUM, unum) != 0) {
1099 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
1100 }
1101
1102 if (serial != NULL) {
1103 if (nvlist_add_string_array(fmri, FM_FMRI_MEM_SERIAL_ID,
1104 (char **)&serial, 1) != 0) {
1105 atomic_inc_64(
1106 &erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
1107 }
1108 if (offset != (uint64_t)-1 && nvlist_add_uint64(fmri,
1109 FM_FMRI_MEM_OFFSET, offset) != 0) {
1110 atomic_inc_64(
1111 &erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
1112 }
1113 }
1114}
1115
1116void
1117fm_fmri_zfs_set(nvlist_t *fmri, int version, uint64_t pool_guid,
1118 uint64_t vdev_guid)
1119{
1120 if (version != ZFS_SCHEME_VERSION0) {
1121 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
1122 return;
1123 }
1124
1125 if (nvlist_add_uint8(fmri, FM_VERSION, version) != 0) {
1126 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
1127 return;
1128 }
1129
1130 if (nvlist_add_string(fmri, FM_FMRI_SCHEME, FM_FMRI_SCHEME_ZFS) != 0) {
1131 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
1132 return;
1133 }
1134
1135 if (nvlist_add_uint64(fmri, FM_FMRI_ZFS_POOL, pool_guid) != 0) {
1136 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
1137 }
1138
1139 if (vdev_guid != 0) {
1140 if (nvlist_add_uint64(fmri, FM_FMRI_ZFS_VDEV, vdev_guid) != 0) {
1141 atomic_inc_64(
1142 &erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
1143 }
1144 }
1145}
1146
1147uint64_t
1148fm_ena_increment(uint64_t ena)
1149{
1150 uint64_t new_ena;
1151
1152 switch (ENA_FORMAT(ena)) {
1153 case FM_ENA_FMT1:
1154 new_ena = ena + (1 << ENA_FMT1_GEN_SHFT);
1155 break;
1156 case FM_ENA_FMT2:
1157 new_ena = ena + (1 << ENA_FMT2_GEN_SHFT);
1158 break;
1159 default:
1160 new_ena = 0;
1161 }
1162
1163 return (new_ena);
1164}
1165
1166uint64_t
1167fm_ena_generate_cpu(uint64_t timestamp, processorid_t cpuid, uchar_t format)
1168{
1169 uint64_t ena = 0;
1170
1171 switch (format) {
1172 case FM_ENA_FMT1:
1173 if (timestamp) {
1174 ena = (uint64_t)((format & ENA_FORMAT_MASK) |
1175 ((cpuid << ENA_FMT1_CPUID_SHFT) &
1176 ENA_FMT1_CPUID_MASK) |
1177 ((timestamp << ENA_FMT1_TIME_SHFT) &
1178 ENA_FMT1_TIME_MASK));
1179 } else {
1180 ena = (uint64_t)((format & ENA_FORMAT_MASK) |
1181 ((cpuid << ENA_FMT1_CPUID_SHFT) &
1182 ENA_FMT1_CPUID_MASK) |
1183 ((gethrtime_waitfree() << ENA_FMT1_TIME_SHFT) &
1184 ENA_FMT1_TIME_MASK));
1185 }
1186 break;
1187 case FM_ENA_FMT2:
1188 ena = (uint64_t)((format & ENA_FORMAT_MASK) |
1189 ((timestamp << ENA_FMT2_TIME_SHFT) & ENA_FMT2_TIME_MASK));
1190 break;
1191 default:
1192 break;
1193 }
1194
1195 return (ena);
1196}
1197
1198uint64_t
1199fm_ena_generate(uint64_t timestamp, uchar_t format)
1200{
1201#ifdef __NetBSD__
1202 return (fm_ena_generate_cpu(timestamp, cpu_index(curcpu()), format));
1203#else
1204 return (fm_ena_generate_cpu(timestamp, PCPU_GET(cpuid), format));
1205#endif
1206}
1207
1208uint64_t
1209fm_ena_generation_get(uint64_t ena)
1210{
1211 uint64_t gen;
1212
1213 switch (ENA_FORMAT(ena)) {
1214 case FM_ENA_FMT1:
1215 gen = (ena & ENA_FMT1_GEN_MASK) >> ENA_FMT1_GEN_SHFT;
1216 break;
1217 case FM_ENA_FMT2:
1218 gen = (ena & ENA_FMT2_GEN_MASK) >> ENA_FMT2_GEN_SHFT;
1219 break;
1220 default:
1221 gen = 0;
1222 break;
1223 }
1224
1225 return (gen);
1226}
1227
1228uchar_t
1229fm_ena_format_get(uint64_t ena)
1230{
1231
1232 return (ENA_FORMAT(ena));
1233}
1234
1235uint64_t
1236fm_ena_id_get(uint64_t ena)
1237{
1238 uint64_t id;
1239
1240 switch (ENA_FORMAT(ena)) {
1241 case FM_ENA_FMT1:
1242 id = (ena & ENA_FMT1_ID_MASK) >> ENA_FMT1_ID_SHFT;
1243 break;
1244 case FM_ENA_FMT2:
1245 id = (ena & ENA_FMT2_ID_MASK) >> ENA_FMT2_ID_SHFT;
1246 break;
1247 default:
1248 id = 0;
1249 }
1250
1251 return (id);
1252}
1253
1254uint64_t
1255fm_ena_time_get(uint64_t ena)
1256{
1257 uint64_t time;
1258
1259 switch (ENA_FORMAT(ena)) {
1260 case FM_ENA_FMT1:
1261 time = (ena & ENA_FMT1_TIME_MASK) >> ENA_FMT1_TIME_SHFT;
1262 break;
1263 case FM_ENA_FMT2:
1264 time = (ena & ENA_FMT2_TIME_MASK) >> ENA_FMT2_TIME_SHFT;
1265 break;
1266 default:
1267 time = 0;
1268 }
1269
1270 return (time);
1271}
1272
1273#ifdef illumos
1274/*
1275 * Convert a getpcstack() trace to symbolic name+offset, and add the resulting
1276 * string array to a Fault Management ereport as FM_EREPORT_PAYLOAD_NAME_STACK.
1277 */
1278void
1279fm_payload_stack_add(nvlist_t *payload, const pc_t *stack, int depth)
1280{
1281 int i;
1282 char *sym;
1283 ulong_t off;
1284 char *stkpp[FM_STK_DEPTH];
1285 char buf[FM_STK_DEPTH * FM_SYM_SZ];
1286 char *stkp = buf;
1287
1288 for (i = 0; i < depth && i != FM_STK_DEPTH; i++, stkp += FM_SYM_SZ) {
1289 if ((sym = kobj_getsymname(stack[i], &off)) != NULL)
1290 (void) snprintf(stkp, FM_SYM_SZ, "%s+%lx", sym, off);
1291 else
1292 (void) snprintf(stkp, FM_SYM_SZ, "%lx", (long)stack[i]);
1293 stkpp[i] = stkp;
1294 }
1295
1296 fm_payload_set(payload, FM_EREPORT_PAYLOAD_NAME_STACK,
1297 DATA_TYPE_STRING_ARRAY, depth, stkpp, NULL);
1298}
1299#endif
1300
1301#ifdef illumos
1302void
1303print_msg_hwerr(ctid_t ct_id, proc_t *p)
1304{
1305 uprintf("Killed process %d (%s) in contract id %d "
1306 "due to hardware error\n", p->p_pid, p->p_user.u_comm, ct_id);
1307}
1308#endif
1309
1310void
1311fm_fmri_hc_create(nvlist_t *fmri, int version, const nvlist_t *auth,
1312 nvlist_t *snvl, nvlist_t *bboard, int npairs, ...)
1313{
1314 nv_alloc_t *nva = nvlist_lookup_nv_alloc(fmri);
1315 nvlist_t *pairs[HC_MAXPAIRS];
1316 nvlist_t **hcl;
1317 uint_t n;
1318 int i, j;
1319 va_list ap;
1320 char *hcname, *hcid;
1321
1322 if (!fm_fmri_hc_set_common(fmri, version, auth))
1323 return;
1324
1325 /*
1326 * copy the bboard nvpairs to the pairs array
1327 */
1328 if (nvlist_lookup_nvlist_array(bboard, FM_FMRI_HC_LIST, &hcl, &n)
1329 != 0) {
1330 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
1331 return;
1332 }
1333
1334 for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
1335 if (nvlist_lookup_string(hcl[i], FM_FMRI_HC_NAME,
1336 &hcname) != 0) {
1337 atomic_inc_64(
1338 &erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
1339 return;
1340 }
1341 if (nvlist_lookup_string(hcl[i], FM_FMRI_HC_ID, &hcid) != 0) {
1342 atomic_inc_64(
1343 &erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
1344 return;
1345 }
1346
1347 pairs[i] = fm_nvlist_create(nva);
1348 if (nvlist_add_string(pairs[i], FM_FMRI_HC_NAME, hcname) != 0 ||
1349 nvlist_add_string(pairs[i], FM_FMRI_HC_ID, hcid) != 0) {
1350 for (j = 0; j <= i; j++) {
1351 if (pairs[j] != NULL)
1352 fm_nvlist_destroy(pairs[j],
1353 FM_NVA_RETAIN);
1354 }
1355 atomic_inc_64(
1356 &erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
1357 return;
1358 }
1359 }
1360
1361 /*
1362 * create the pairs from passed in pairs
1363 */
1364 npairs = MIN(npairs, HC_MAXPAIRS);
1365
1366 va_start(ap, npairs);
1367 for (i = n; i < npairs + n; i++) {
1368 const char *name = va_arg(ap, const char *);
1369 uint32_t id = va_arg(ap, uint32_t);
1370 char idstr[11];
1371 (void) snprintf(idstr, sizeof (idstr), "%u", id);
1372 pairs[i] = fm_nvlist_create(nva);
1373 if (nvlist_add_string(pairs[i], FM_FMRI_HC_NAME, name) != 0 ||
1374 nvlist_add_string(pairs[i], FM_FMRI_HC_ID, idstr) != 0) {
1375 for (j = 0; j <= i; j++) {
1376 if (pairs[j] != NULL)
1377 fm_nvlist_destroy(pairs[j],
1378 FM_NVA_RETAIN);
1379 }
1380 atomic_inc_64(
1381 &erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
1382 return;
1383 }
1384 }
1385 va_end(ap);
1386
1387 /*
1388 * Create the fmri hc list
1389 */
1390 if (nvlist_add_nvlist_array(fmri, FM_FMRI_HC_LIST, pairs,
1391 npairs + n) != 0) {
1392 atomic_inc_64(&erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
1393 return;
1394 }
1395
1396 for (i = 0; i < npairs + n; i++) {
1397 fm_nvlist_destroy(pairs[i], FM_NVA_RETAIN);
1398 }
1399
1400 if (snvl != NULL) {
1401 if (nvlist_add_nvlist(fmri, FM_FMRI_HC_SPECIFIC, snvl) != 0) {
1402 atomic_inc_64(
1403 &erpt_kstat_data.fmri_set_failed.value.ui64);
1404 return;
1405 }
1406 }
1407}
1408
